body_html:
1. __setattr__(self, attr) is a convention method for the syntax obj[attr]. Unlike Javascript, obj.a and obj[a] are completely different.
  2. In Python, objects are passed by reference by default. Thus using None as buffer has no meaning.
  3. register_buffer accepts a Tensor as the second argument.
body_text:
__setattr__(self, attr) is a convention method for the syntax obj[attr]. Unlike Javascript, obj.a and obj[a] are completely different.
In Python, objects are passed by reference by default. Thus using None as buffer has no meaning.
register_buffer accepts a Tensor as the second argument.
body:
1. `__setattr__(self, attr)` is a convention method for the syntax `obj[attr]`. Unlike Javascript, `obj.a` and `obj[a]` are completely different. 
2. In Python, objects are passed by reference by default. Thus using `None` as buffer has no meaning.
3. [`register_buffer`](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.Module.register_buffer) accepts a `Tensor` as the second argument.
